byline.contributor: Meghan Garrity reported from State College, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By MEGHAN GARRITY and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Pennsylvania State University chapter of Kappa Delta Rho fraternity may face criminal charges following disclosure of secret fraternity website containing photographs of drug activity, hazing and nude, unconscious women; Kappa Delta Rho committee imposes one-year suspension on its Penn State chapter.
lead_paragraph: A clandestine website — with images of drugs, hazing and nude, unconscious women — was the subject of a police inquiry that led to the suspension of a fraternity’s chapter at Penn State.

headline.main: Penn State Fraternity’s Secret Facebook Photos May Lead to Criminal Charges
headline.print_headline: Penn State Fraternity’s Secret Facebook Photos May Lead to Criminal Charges

snippet: A clandestine website — with images of drugs, hazing and nude, unconscious women — was the subject of a police inquiry that led to the suspension of a fraternity’s chapter at Penn State.
